docs.snippet: King Bhumibol Adulyadej was so revered that many Thai people around the country fainted or felt unwell when they learnt this week that he had died after 70 years on the throne.

headline.print_headline: For Thais Overcome by the King's Death, Medics and a Hotline
headline.main: For Thais Overcome by the King's Death, Medics and a Hotline

docs.snippet: The compulsion to toss a partly filled bottle and try to get it to land upright has captivated children. But for parents the repetitive noise of flipping (gurgle), landing (thud) and grabbing (crunch) the bottles is brutal.

headline.main: Bottle-Flipping Craze Is Fun for Children but Torture for Parents

docs.snippet: After a four-year battle, the last rebel fighters agreed to turn over their territory. The United Nations reported that scores were killed as pro-government forces moved in.

headline.print_headline: Fight for Aleppo Ends With Defeat for Syria Rebels
headline.main: Battle Over Aleppo Is Over, Russia Says, as Evacuation Deal Reached

docs.abstract: Russia announces deal in which Syrian rebel fighters agree to turn over their territory within Aleppo to Syrian government, ending four-year battle over nation's largest city; deal, if carried out, would mark major turning point in Syria's nearly six-year war; news comes as United Nations reports scores of civilians were killed while pro-government forces were moving in.

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Rex Tillerson, Aleppo, Golden Globe Awards: Your Tuesday Briefing

docs.snippet: Following the deadly attacks in 2015, the French government is seeking to turn the national anthem, often associated with the political right, into a symbol of unity.

headline.print_headline: The twists and turns of ‘La Marseillaise’
headline.main: The Twists and Turns of ‘La Marseillaise’

docs.snippet: The people of the Philippines are taking to the streets to protest their brutal new president.

headline.print_headline: Standing up  to Duterte’s brutal tactics

docs.snippet: Calling Donald Trump an "authoritarian character" and a threat to democracy, Meg Whitman, a prominent Republican fundraiser and chief executive of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, endorsed Democrat Hillary Clinton's White House bid late Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Hewlett Packard's Meg Whitman Joins CEOs Endorsing Clinton
headline.main: Hewlett Packard's Meg Whitman Joins CEOs Endorsing Clinton

docs.snippet: An Alabama probate judge accused of sending sexually charged messages and nude photos to a woman he met when she went to his office to wed another man has agreed to a six-month unpaid suspension, his lawyer said Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Alabama Judge Suspended Over Sexually Charged Messages
headline.main: Alabama Judge Suspended Over Sexually Charged Messages

docs.snippet: Advances in technology have prompted the campaigns to try to bypass major news networks and speak to voters using Facebook Live, Snapchat and other services.

headline.print_headline: Live Videos, Small Screens: Campaigns Hope Voters Like What They See
headline.main: Live Videos, Small Screens: Campaigns Hope Voters Like What They See

docs.abstract: Viewers of Democratic National Convention will be able to watch event on smartphones and tablets; behind-the-scenes video streaming over social media is produced by in-house unit run by Hillary Clinton's campaign and Democratic National Committee, as part of effort to bypass major news networks and go straight to voters.

docs.snippet: A proposal to completely ban abortion in Poland is posing a dilemma for the ruling conservatives, wary of antagonizing the powerful Catholic Church if they fail to support it or fanning public outcry if they do.

headline.print_headline: Proposed Abortion Ban a Dilemma for Polish Ruling Party
headline.main: Proposed Abortion Ban a Dilemma for Polish Ruling Party
